findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract.

findings.title: Using 'greater than or equal to' operator for the payment check
findings.description: When selling tokens, it is checked if the payment sent (msg.value) is greater than or equal to the price. Users can mistakenly send more coins, or the price can be changed, and users will pay more than needed.

findings.title: Unsafe treasury address using
findings.description: The functionality does not allow to change the _deploymentConfig.treasuryAddress value. If the defined address is compromised, irrelevant, or wrongly specified, it will not be possible to change it.

findings.title: Missing events emit on changing important values
findings.description: The contract does not emit any events after changing important values.

findings.title: There is no Presale finish time in the _runtimeConfig variable
findings.description: The presaleActive function does not check if the Presale phase finished, causing it to always be available and occur simultaneously with Public sale.

findings.title: Requirements Violation
findings.description: The code should be compliant with the requirements provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Denial of Service vulnerability
findings.description: Execution of the code should never be blocked by a specific contract state unless it is required.
